info.author: runarsf
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License v3 (GPLv3)
info.description:
# fssh > Grant temporary SSH access to a trusted individual. ## Prerequisites * python3 * requirements.txt ## Installation * linux ```bash # Go to the directory where you want the fssh folder to be (e.g. 'cd ~/git/') git clone https://github.com/runarsf/fssh.git cd fssh chmod +x fssh.py ``` * pip ```bash Coming soon (tm) python3 -m pip install f-ssh ``` ## Usage ```bash ./fssh.py --help # or python3 fssh.py --help # or python fssh.py --help ``` ## Examples * GitHub user ```bash ./fssh.py -r -u runarsf ``` * Public key as argument ```bash ./fssh.py -r -k "publicPartOfSSHKeypair" ``` * Public key as file ```bash ./fssh.py -r -k /path/to/file/id_rsa.pub ``` * Multiple users - You can also add multiple SSH keys if you're pointing to a file. ```bash ./fssh.py -r -u runarsf -k "publicPartOfSSHKeypairOrFilePath" ``` ## How it works fssh grabs the public part of an SSH keypair from the open GitHub API and adds it to `~/.ssh/known_hosts`. When the script is terminated it restores the known_hosts file to it's previous state. The backup file is stored at `~/.ssh/known_hosts_fssh`. Any changes made to the known_hosts file while the script is running will be discarded when the script is terminated.
The connected user(s) will **not** lose connection to the machine when the script is terminated, but they will not be able to reconnect. > **fssh** © [runarsf](https://github.com/runarsf) · Author and maintainer.
> Released under the [GPLv3](https://github.com/runarsf/fssh/blob/master/LICENSE) License.
info.name: fssh
